alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Milwaukee; Racine; Walworth; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 25 at 5:59PM CDT until September 25 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Milwaukee County in southeastern Wisconsin... Northern Walworth County in southeastern Wisconsin... Racine County in southeastern Wisconsin... Waukesha County in southeastern Wisconsin... Southern Jefferson County in southeastern Wisconsin... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 559 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Germantown to Oconomowoc to Fort Atkinson, moving southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Milwaukee, Racine, Waukesha, West Allis, Wauwatosa, New Berlin, Brookfield, Greenfield, Menomonee Falls, Oak Creek, Mount Pleasant, Muskego, South Milwaukee, Cudahy, Whitewater, Whitefish Bay, Greendale, Pewaukee, Fort Atkinson and Brown Deer. People attending Harvest Fest at State Fair should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes the following Locations Boerner Botanical Gardens, General Mitchell International Airport, Timmerman Airport, Froedert & the Medical College, Fiserv Forum, Pewaukee Lake, Ottawa Lake Recreation Area, and Pinewoods Campground. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
